About / Departments, Centers & Initiatives / Centers of Research / Glucksman Institute for Research in Securities Markets                        Share / Print                Print      Email      Share       Like                                                                Glucksman Institute for Research in Securities Markets   The Glucksman Institute, endowed by a grant from Lewis Glucksman, Stern MBA '51, offers faculty and student grants to support research on equities, bonds, futures, options, and other financial instruments and on the markets where they are traded.    Twenty-five of the best performing first year full-time MBA students are invited to apply for five Glucksman Fellow awards. During their second year, these Fellows receive cash stipends and are paired with full-time faculty members to conduct research projects. Participating faculty members receive unrestricted grants as well. The program exposes some top MBA students to the rigors of formal academic research in the practical areas of financial economics.    To recognize and promote excellence in research, the Institute also awards an annual $6,000 prize for the best research paper in finance by a Stern faculty member.    These programs, as well as the Institute’s other activities, are coordinated with the Salomon Center .                                       Links      Current Fellows    Research Reports                     Contact the Glucksman Institute    The L. Glucksman Institute for Research in Securities Markets  Stern School of Business  44 West 4th Street  New York, NY 10012  Tel: 212-998-0700  Fax: 212-995-4220  E-mail: William Silber ( wsilber@stern.nyu.edu ) or Mary Jaffier ( mjaffier@stern.nyu.edu )                                                              Glucksman Institute for Research in Securities Markets     Institute Overview   Research                           News      NYU Stern Center for Business and Human Rights to Tackle Migrant Labor Rights in the Construction Industry    Foreign Policy Association Awards Medal to Dean Peter Henry    Follow @NYUStern on Twitter and like NYU Stern on Facebook         Basics      Directions & Maps    Faculty Directory    Contact Us                                 FACULTY OPINIONS    Read Stern faculty opinions on  relevant business topics             Sitemap | Privacy | © 2015 Leonard N.                                     47th Annual Conference on Capital Markets in Real Estate                              The Millennial Real Estate Generation: Cyber Age Approach to Investing, Financing, Shopping, and Living              The expansion of the global real estate capital markets for senior/subordinated debt and public/private equity has ignited financing, acquisition, and development beyond historic peaks. Opportunities abound as liquidity flows in the U.S. and investors seek compelling investment returns amidst European market recovery.   The real estate landscape is being transformed by new drivers of demand and productivity from the "millennial generation," our largest cohort of deep-pocketed, sophisticated consumers. Their desire for individual freedom, work-life flexibility, and access to communal social networking space and technology is creating new waves of dynamism in the office, residential, retail, and hospitality real estate sectors.   Join real estate leaders and a deep bench of other industry participants at the 47th Annual Conference on Capital Markets in Real Estate on November 19, 2014.         Conference Information     Date: November 19, 2014   Location: The Pierre Hotel   Grand Ballroom   New York, NY               Sponsorship Opportunities            For inquiries on sponsorship opportunities, please contact Jessica Estrada-Watson at jessica.watson@nyu.edu or call (212) 992-3618 .              Chair        Robert S. Blumenthal  Managing Director, Deutsche Bank Securities Inc.;  Executive Committee Member, Schack Institute of Real Estate                Co-Chairs          Jeffrey A. Barclay  Managing Director, Goldman, Sachs & Co.;  Executive Committee Member, Schack Institute of Real Estate           Richard A. Kessler  Chief Operating Officer, Benenson Capital Partners, LLC;  Executive Committee Member and Adjunct Associate Professor, Schack Institute of Real Estate           Wendy Silverstein  Executive Vice President, Co-Head–Acquisitions and Capital Markets, Vornado Realty Trust                                                                                                      QUICK LINKS                        About Us          Student Affairs          Visit Us          School-wide Policies          Contact Us                       ATTEND THE SCHOOL                        Graduate Admissions          Undergraduate Admissions          Noncredit Registration                             ON THE WEB                         On Facebook          On Twitter          On YouTube          Browser Requirements                                                        NYU Homepage    © New York University School of Professional Studies | Privacy Policy

The specialization may be suitable for students pursuing careers in the securities industry or the broad area of investment management.     Sample Courses:                           Applications of Portfolio Analysis       Behavioral Finance       Debt Instruments and Markets       Equity Markets: Trading and Structure                           Futures and Options       Investment Strategies       Trading Strategies and Systems       Volatility                        Please note that this is a selection of courses and is subject to change. For more information, visit the course index .             Especially Applicable to Careers in Finance such as:                           Asset Management       Financial Engineering       General Finance                           Public Finance       Risk
